headline: Shane will attend the international [BioGeoSCAPES](https://biogeoscapes.org/) science planning workshop in Woods Hole, Massachusetts

Shane, Milla, and Amanda will attend the [Experimental Evolution and Community Dynamics](https://www.fimar.fi/event-details-registration/eecd-seminar-2023) workshop at the [Tvärminne Zoological Station](https://www.helsinki.fi/en/research-stations/tvarminne-zoological-station) in Tvärminne, Finland.
Inga-Katariina Aapalampi successfully defends her MSc thesis. Congrats Inga-Katariina!
Olli Pitkänen successfully defends his MSc thesis. Congrats Olli!

Shane is awarded a Research Council of Finland [Academy Research Fellowship](https://www.aka.fi/en/research-funding/funding-opportunities-at-a-glance/funding-for-individual-researchers/) to fund the group for the next 4 years!
Shane has a [new paper in ISME J](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41396-023-01361-9) on microbial predatory-prey coevolution!
Thomas Hackl's paper on novel mobile genetic elements in *Prochlorococcus* [is out in Cell!](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cell.2022.12.006)
Shane gives an invited talk at the BioGeoSCAPES Pan-European workshop, EU 2022 Euromarine in Zagreb, Croatia.
Shane gives a plenary presentation at the [Tvärminne Symposium on Polar Microbes and Viruses](http://polarmicrobio.me/) in Tvärminne, Finland.
